name: Canonical λ-Theorem — λ Generates Modal Curvature
intent: Formalize λ as the curvature of the mode-augmented deviation connection and show that all modal curvature is generated by the mode field M.

statement.decomposition: For any Box B with mode field M, λ(B) = λ_curv(B) + λ_mode(B) + λ_cross(B). λ_curv is the curvature of δ alone, λ_mode is linear in M, λ_cross is nonlinear (quadratic or higher) in M.
statement.generation: λ_mode(B) = δ(M)(B) + [δ, M](B) and λ_cross(B) = M ∧ M(B). Thus λ_mode and λ_cross depend only on M and vanish when M = 0.
statement.modal_flatness: λ_modal(B) = 0 (i.e. λ_mode(B) = 0 and λ_cross(B) = 0) if and only if there exists a local mode potential U such that M = δU up to gauge, making ∇M mode-flat.
